result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Ray Peabody was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremy Ray Peabody is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremy Ray Peabody was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Howard W. Cameron November 24, 2014 - amend JOC for credit.

-Concurrent to 13CF185.
-Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

superMiscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected with prison wages and balance to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF277.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF277.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant must inform Probation Agent if on any prescriptions.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Concurrent to 13CF185.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb.  ADA: Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY: Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp, DF: Jeremy Ray Peabody appeared from jail.  Court called at 2:00 p.m. Includes case 13CF185, 13CF318 & 14CF277.  Hearing today is to figure the credit for jail time.  ADA Gehler advises the court the DE will get 443 days credit for 13CF185 and 97 days for 14CF277 which is concurrent with 13CF185.  Zero days credit for 13CF318 is consecutive to 13CF185 & 14CF277.  Sentence credit is 443 as of 10/14/14.  Court adjourned at 2:18 p.m. lw
Filed by Assistant District Attorney Kevin Gehler re: credit. Includes 13CF185, 13CF318 and 14CF277. w/file to HWC.
Filed by M. Solsvig. Re: status of Def. Reviewed by HWC. km
Def & Atty signed this date. eif
filed by Judge Howard W. Cameron to Atty's regarding another sentence hearing to get correct days of credit. eif

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb.  ADA: Kevin H. Gehler, Emily Anderson from the DOC. DF ATTY: Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp, DF: Jeremy Ray Peabody appeared from jail.  Court called at 9:34 a.m.  Includes case 13CF185, 13CF318 & 14CF277.  DE pleads Gulity to Ct 1 in 14CF277.  Crt informs DE of rights.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF277 without the repeater. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 14CF277. Sentencing arguments by attorneys for case 13CF185, 13CF318 & 14CF277. Crt orders:

13CF185
-Prison for 2 years with 2 years E/S

-Credit for 443 days served
-DE eligible for Challenge and Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program

Conditions of the E/S
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-DE must inform probation agent if on any prescriptions.

13CF318 
-Prison for 18 months with 18 months E/S consecutive to the 13CF185

-DE eligible for Challenge and Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program
- Court Costs of $268.00 plus 250 DNA surcharge (apply $114.50 on file) payable with prison wages and any remaining costs through the DOC

Conditions of the E/S
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-DE must inform probation agent if on any prescriptions.

14CF277
- Prison for 2 years and 2 years E/S concurrent to 13CF185

- Court Costs of $268.00 plus $250 DNA surcharge payable with prison wages and any remaining costs through the DOC

Conditions of the E/S
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-DE must inform probation agent if on any prescriptions.

Jail credit for 13CF318 & 14CF277 will be determined.  Sentencing hearing continued.  ADA Gehler and Attorney Kemp will schedule with the JA. lw

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb.  ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY: Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp, DF: Jeremy Ray Peabody appeared from jail.  Court called at 8:44 a.m.  Includes case 13CF185, 13CF318 & 14CF277.  Attorney Kemp advises the court they are close to an agreement.  Set 13CF185 & 13CF318 for sentencing.  14CF277 set for status.  Court adjourned.  lw  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Filed by ADA Hahn. km
Filed by ADA Hahn. km
signed by Def. & Atty this date. eif
Status conference on September 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY: Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp, DF: Jeremy Ray Peabody appeared from jail.  Court called at 10:45 a.m. Includes case 13CF318 & 14CF277.   DE files with the court the Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver for 14CF277.  Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause and binds the DE over for trial.  Attorney Kemp is asking the court to put a 8 year hold on the Diversion Agreement in 13CF318.  ADA Gehler asks the court to revoke the Diversion Agreement.  Court finds the DE Guilty in 13CF318 on Count 1.  Set for STC on 13CF185, 13CF318 & 14CF277.  Court adjourned 11:01 a.m. lw  Status conference scheduled for September 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
